paragraphs.text: Bato was a member of the Southern Water Tribe and a close friend of Katara and Sokka's father, Hakoda, since childhood. He was somewhat of a paternal figure to Katara and Sokka in their father's stead, thus he cared about their well-being and was a loyal and brave warrior who would do anything to protect his tribe.

paragraphs.body: Bato was born and raised in the Southern Water Tribe, and he was good friends with Hakoda. The two of them often played pranks on other members of the tribe and enjoyed spending time together.

paragraphs.body: During their travels, ${link_0}, Katara, and Sokka found Bato's ship on a beach. Bato was Hakoda's best friend as a child and through him, Sokka and Katara felt a connection to their father that they had not had in years. The three talked and reminisced long into the night, leaving out Aang. paragraphs.text: That summer, Bato was a part of the invasion force which intended to attack the Fire Nation Capital on the Day of Black Sun. He was one of the many warriors to land on the Fire Nation Capital beach and proved to be a good leader during the attack. When Hakoda was unable to guide the invasion force, Bato took over his position of leadership, seemingly becoming the new commander of the soldiers. When Aang failed to defeat Fire Lord Ozai, the younger soldiers were told to escape on Appa while the adults surrendered, Bato among them. Hakoda later stated that Bato and the remainder of the invasion force were sent to the Capital City Prison.

paragraphs.body: The pronunciation of Bato is similar to bateau, the French word for "boat". Seeing as he is the one that initiates Sokka to ice dodging using his boat, it is an appropriate name. It should also be noted that "Bato" is an anagram for "Boat".

paragraphs.body: When Bato first encountered Sokka at the abbey, he was recovering from a battle and had the majority of his torso and left arm bandaged. When he met him again sometime later at Chameleon Bay, Bato had recovered. His bandages were removed, however, his skin was still marred red from the burns. By the time of the invasion of the Fire Nation capital, his arm was perfectly healed.
